back.text:
Root: ق ر ع (Q-R-ʿ)
Meaning: The Striking Calamity
Pronunciation: Al-Qāriʿah
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'قَا'.
Derived Words:
1. قَرْع (Qarʿ): A strike, knocking
2. مَقْرُوع (Maqrūʿ): Stricken
3. قَارِع (Qāriʿ): Knocker
Example Ayah: This is the name of the Surah and a unique term in the Quran.

hint.text: The title of the Surah, referring to the Day of Judgment.

back.text:
Root: ف ر ش (F-R-SH)
Meaning: Like scattered moths
Pronunciation: Kal-farāsh
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah**.
Derived Words:
1. فِرَاش (Firāsh): A bed, moth
2. مَفْرُوش (Mafrūsh): Spread out
Example Ayah: This is a unique simile in the Quran.

hint.text: A description of people on the Day of Judgment.

back.text:
Root: ب ث ث (B-TH-TH)
Meaning: The scattered
Pronunciation: Al-Mabthūth
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'ثُو'.
Derived Words:
1. بَثّ (Bathth): Scattering, broadcasting
2. مَبْثُوث (Mabthūth): Scattered
Example Ayah: وَزَرَابِيُّ مَبْثُوثَةٌ

Root: ج ب ل (J-B-L)
Meaning: The mountains
Pronunciation: Al-Jibālu
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'بَا'.
Derived Words:
1. جَبَل (Jabal): A mountain
2. جِبَال (Jibāl): Mountains (plural)
Example Ayah: وَتَرَى الْجِبَالَ تَحْسَبُهَا جَامِدَةً

hint.text: They will be like tufted wool.

back.text:
Root: ع ه ن (ʿ-H-N)
Meaning: Like tufted wool
Pronunciation: Kal-ʿihn
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah**.
Derived Words: This noun is unique to this simile in the Quran.
Example Ayah: This is a unique simile in the Quran.

Root: ن ف ش (N-F-SH)
Meaning: The carded, blown about
Pronunciation: Al-Manfūsh
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'فُو'.
Derived Words:
1. نَفْش (Nafsh): Fluffing
2. مَنْفُوش (Manfūsh): Carded, fluffed
Example Ayah: This word is unique in its usage in the Quran.

Root: ث ق ل (Th-Q-L)
Meaning: Are heavy
Pronunciation: Thaqulat
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation.
Derived Words:
1. ثَقِيل (Thaqīl): Heavy
2. ثِقَل (Thiqal): Weight
3. مُثَقَّل (Muthaqqal): Made heavy
Example Ayah: وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَاءَهُمْ يَوْمًا ثَقِيلًا

hint.text: A description of the person's scales.

back.text:
Root: و ز ن (W-Z-N)
Meaning: His scales
Pronunciation: Mawāzīnuh
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on 'وَا' and 'زِي'.
Derived Words:
1. مِيزَان (Mīzān): A scale
2. وَزْن (Wazn): A weight
Example Ayah: وَنَضَعُ الْمَوَازِينَ الْقِسْطَ لِيَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ

hint.text: What will be weighed on the Day of Judgment.

back.text:
Root: ر ض و (R-Ḍ-W)
Meaning: Pleasing, satisfactory
Pronunciation: Rāḍiyah
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on 'رَا' and **Isti'lā** on 'ض'.
Derived Words:
1. رِضْوَان (Riḍwān): Satisfaction
2. رَاضٍ (Rāḍin): Content, pleased
Example Ayah: ارْجِعِي إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةً مَّرْضِيَّةً

hint.text: A description of a person's life in Paradise.

back.text:
Root: خ ف ف (Kh-F-F)
Meaning: Are light
Pronunciation: Khaffat
Tajweed Rules: **Shaddah** on the 'فّ'.
Derived Words:
1. خَفِيف (Khafīf): Light
2. خِفَّة (Khiffah): Lightness
Example Ayah: This is a unique verb used in the context of scales.

Root: ه و ي (H-W-Y)
Meaning: A plunging fire, abyss
Pronunciation: Hāwiyah
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'هَا'.
Derived Words:
1. هَوَىٰ (Hawā): He fell
2. هُوِيّ (Huwiyy): Descent, falling
Example Ayah: This noun is unique to this Surah.

Root: ح م ي (Ḥ-M-Y)
Meaning: Intensely hot
Pronunciation: Ḥāmiyah
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'حَا'.
Derived Words:
1. حَمِيم (Ḥamīm): Boiling water
2. حَمَى (Ḥamā): To protect or to heat
Example Ayah: This is a unique descriptive noun in the Quran.
